title: Japanese-Style Sesame Green Beans
description: Fresh green beans get a flavor boost from sesame oil and a splash of soy sauce. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Green Beans Japanese-Style Sesame Green Beans 4.5 (471) 318 Reviews 33 Photos I discovered this dish at my Japanese mother-in-law's house during a family holiday buffet. She had many friends who brought wonderful Japanese dishes, and this was and has remained one of my favorites. It's light and fresh any time of the year. Submitted by Cooking_Muse Updated on January 7, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 33 33 33 33 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 tablespoon canola oil 1 ½ teaspoons sesame oil 1 pound fresh green beans, washed 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds Directions Warm a large skillet or wok over medium heat. When the skillet is hot, pour in canola and sesame oils, then place whole green beans into the skillet. Stir the beans to coat with oil. Cook until the beans are bright green and slightly browned in spots, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in soy sauce; cover, and let sit about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. I Made It Print 575 home cooks made it! They were good but i found them salty. Next time i will cut back on the soy sauce. Thank you for the recipe. 06 of 33 Photo by  Melissa Sours Reid 09/07/2017 07 of 33 Photo by  chrystal 07/16/2016 08 of 33 Photo by  chrystal 07/16/2016 09 of 33 Photo by  bxmaryjane 01/02/2016 10 of 33 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 08/05/2015 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Lemony Green Beans with Walnuts and Thyme 27 Ratings Pan Fried Green Beans 103 Ratings Quick Sesame Green Beans 172 Ratings Sesame Green Beans 681 Ratings Green Beans for a Special Occasion 98 Ratings Chinese Garlic Green Beans 397 Ratings Dad's Pan-Fried Green Beans 417 Ratings Grilled Soy-Sesame Asparagus 147 Ratings Chinese Green Bean Stir-Fry 91 Ratings Snow on the Mountain Green Beans 132 Ratings Chinese Peppered Green Beans 26 Ratings Lemon Pepper Green Beans 382 Ratings Green Bean and Potato Salad 197 Ratings Savory Green Beans 56 Ratings Lemon Lentil Rice 7 Ratings Green Bean Curry 32 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Cooking_Muse
instructions: Warm a large skillet or wok over medium heat. When the skillet is hot, pour in canola and sesame oils, then place whole green beans into the skillet. Stir the beans to coat with oil. Cook until the beans are bright green and slightly browned in spots, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in soy sauce; cover, and let sit about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
